title: Coat hangers
brief_description: “No! Wire! Hangers … ever!” The now famous line from 1981 kitsch classic Mommie Dearest depicted coat hangers as the bane of Joan Crawford’s existence (among other things). And while that might be true in the context of this docudrama, they’ve also been a consistent presence on film sets since the dawn of the moving image. Practical and ingenious, coat hangers come in all shapes and sizes. This simple domestic object has been handmade or manufactured in wood, metal, plastic or wire. (The wire ones could also be bent into a map-of-Australia car aerial!) Coat hangers are an essential tool in the costume department.
